content: "One of the things that we need to be sensitive to is the very real feelings among southern border states and in Mexico that if things are being done on the Mexican border, they should also be done on the Canadian border," Janet Napolitano, the secretary of homeland security, told a Canada-U.S. border conference. The daylong Brookings Institution event featured dozens of participants from both countries discussing ways in which the movement of goods and people across the Canada-U.S. border could be facilitated. Napolitano's remarks closed the event on an almost depressing note. "We shouldn't go light on one and heavy on the other," she said of the Canadian and Mexican borders. "This is one NAFTA, one area, one continent, and there should be parity there." +++http://www.michaelgraham.com/ I feel like the whole world has just gone nuts. PLUM LOCO!

content: Canadians have illegals crossing into their borders too. Some of them are Americans. If you ask me we should cooperate WITH Canada to secure the ports of entry and exterior borders, like they do in the European Union. I'm not saying we share finances/government like the Europeans do, we're too different, but that we share border responsibilities so that both nations can focus on drug interdiction and terrorist threats, rather than the border between us and Canada. But then again, Canada is rather worried about weapons trafficking, and we gots rather a lot of them. Might not work out.
